scenarioDescription:
The 18 Del Exoplanetary System


Overview

18 Del is a star with 2.3 times the mass of the Sun, and 8.5 times its radius. It is located 248.60 light years away from the solar system.

18 Del is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the 18 Del system


18 Del b

18 Del b was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory observatory, in 2008-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.60 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of 18 Del b is 3275.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of 18 Del b is 12.500 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, 18 Del b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system 18 Del, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Okayama Astrophysical Observatory.
name: 18 Del - System With 1 Exoplanet
